subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Written QS notes
msgSnippet: Jon: So nice to have lured you out of your electronic cave.  In response to the post below:  My own QS is quite vertical, but so is my TO.  Also, I am
messageBody:
Jon:

So nice to have lured you out of your electronic cave. In response to
the post below: My own QS is quite vertical, but so is my TO. Also, I
am left-handed, which may factor in to this.

Paige

Jon Zuck wrote:

> Hey, Chuck, we all make a few little typos! Nice job, and a very neat
> hand.
> I have a question: are you very comfortable with the relatively
> vertical letters -- is that your natural hand in TO, too, or is it
> from copying Kingsley's letters? As soon as I began writing in Read
> (and there are several weeks in my journal in Read) I began to feel
> the need for a natural slant, and so my own hand looks quite different
> from yours and Kingsley's.
>
> jon
>
> -----Original Message-----
> *From:* Chuck Peck [mailto:chuck091956@...]
> *Sent:* Tuesday, May 18, 2004 11:21 AM
> *To:* read_alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> *Subject:* [Read_Alphabet] Written QS notes
>
> Hello All,
>
> After sending out the writing, it was noted to me that I had some
> typos. Not phonetic errors, just plain old messed up things.
>
> I guess this writing will help me as much as anyone else!
>
> One of those errors is that I did not set the "The" adbrevation as
> a deep charater.
>
> The orignal text is:
> ***********************************************
> Mr. Caryll, lately from Rome, stood by the window, looking out
> over the rainswept, steaming quays to Notre Dame on the island
> yonder. Overhead rolled and crackled the artillery of an
> April thunderstorm, and Mr. Caryll, looking out upon Paris in
> her shroud of rain, under her pall of thundercloud, felt
> himself at harmony with Nature. Over his heart, too, the
> gloom of storm was lowering, just as in his heart it was still
> little more than April time.
> ***********************************************
>
> Have a great day all!
> Chuck
>

Jon:  

So nice to have lured you out of your electronic cave.  In response to 
the post below:  My own QS is quite vertical, but so is my TO.  Also, I 
am left-handed, which may factor in to this.

Paige

> Hey, Chuck, we all make a few little typos!  Nice job, and a very neat

> I have a question: are you very comfortable with the relatively 
> vertical letters -- is that your natural hand in TO, too, or is it

> (and there are several weeks in my journal in Read) I began to feel 
> the need for a natural slant, and so my own hand looks quite different 
> from yours and Kingsley's.
>  
> jon
